page.title: 08THATCHING AT THRESHERS FARM
page.content: THRESHERS FARM:{498094.}is having its barn roof re-thatched this year-see photo. The thatcher & his son come from the small town of Hockley-S.E. Essex. The family have thatched since 1850-this is the 4th-5th generation The re-covering will take some 4 weeks to complete and will cost around Â£3000 The wheat straw is grown at Newton near Hockley. The sequence of work is to first strip off the wire -mesh ; protection from high winds & birds. The new straw is hosed with water to render it flexible. Heads & tails are mixed.The straw is 'yealmed',straightened & laid & pressed into a thatchers 'dog': a Y- shaped branch one metre long & sharpened at the base so as to be stuck into the old thatch whilst the new straw is lifted out &laid, starting at the eaves & working
